OWL (INTELIGENCIA ARTIFICIAL - GRADO INFORMÁTICA)

Material de las clases sobre OWL (Web Ontology Language):

  • Clase 1.
  • Clase 2.
  • Clase 3.
  • Clase 4: Grupo mañana, Grupo tarde.
  • Clase 5.
  • Clase 6.

Ejercicios del curso 2010-2011 (Estas clases serían equivalentes a la parte de Lógica Descriptiva del tema 2): http://delicias.dia.fi.upm.es/wiki/index.php/InteligenciaArtificial10-11

Material adicional:

  • Protégé OWL tutorial (http://owl.cs.manchester.ac.uk/tutorials/protegeowltutorial/).
  • OWL Reasoning Examples and Hands-On Session (http://owl.man.ac.uk/2005/07/sssw/).
  • Manchester OWL Syntax (http://www.co-ode.org/resources/reference/manchester_syntax/).
  • Alan Rector, Nick Drummond, Matthew Horridge, Jeremy Rogers, Holger Knublauch, Robert Stevens, Hai Wang, and Chris Wroe. OWL pizzas: Practical experience of teaching OWL-DL: Common errors and common patterns (EKAW 2004). [pdf]
  • Nick Drummond, Alan L. Rector, Robert Stevens, Georgina Moulton, Matthew Horridge, Hai Wang, Julian Seidenberg. Putting OWL in Order: Patterns for Sequences in OWL (OWLed 2006). [pdf]
  • Ejemplos (http://www.gong.manchester.ac.uk/odp/html/index.html, http://ontologydesignpatterns.org).
